intro: Epidendrum intermedium, commonly known as the Intermediate Epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is an epiphytic plant, meaning it grows on other plants without being parasitic, typically in humid, shaded environments. The plant features long, arching stems with clusters of fragrant, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. Epidendrum intermedium is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in greenhouses or as a houseplant.
